page.title: 03The Re-Opening of Aerodrome
page.content: Shepway District Council is hoping to re-open the World War 2 airfield at Hawkinge. It will be used by light aircraft. At a meeting in the village 76 people voted against the scheme.The villagers fear possible noise,safety and traffic problems. 60 letters of protest have been received by the council covering 23 grounds of objection.A petition of opposition containing 100 signatures has been received. Many villagers support the proposed scheme.A full meeting of Shepway District Council will decide on the scheme. A local comment: Local Councillor_Maybe it does mean buisiness for the area but we should not support it if it means disquiet and discomfort for the locals.
